ISSUE.TITLE: Man pages of service_destinations configuration out of date
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Current man pages says: https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/2cc32742898843fc35d5aae3bf787f2221795735/docs/source/markdown/podman-remote.1.md#L73 https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/d0d1af338a500f2ad00d5ce0638901465602817d/docs/source/markdown/podman.1.md#L185 However, podman is using `[engine.service_destinations]` instead. I found this problem using Arch Linux's podman package, where the default configuration is wrong. Here's a part of `/usr/share/containers/containers.conf` on install: ``` # map of service destinations # #[service_destinations] # [service_destinations.production] # URI to access the Podman service # Examples: # rootless "unix://run/user/$UID/podman/podman.sock" (Default) # rootful "unix://run/podman/podman.sock (Default) # remote rootless ssh://engineering.lab.company.com/run/user/1000/podman/podman.sock # remote rootful ssh://root@10.10.1.136:22/run/podman/podman.sock # # uri = "ssh://user@production.example.com/run/user/1001/podman/podman.sock" # Path to file containing ssh identity key # identity = "~/.ssh/id_rsa" ```

COMMIT.MESSAGE: [CI:DOCS] Fix service_destinations description in podman man page - [service_destinations] should be [engine.service_destinations] - service_destinations does not read from `/usr/share/containers/containers.conf` because podman uses config.ReadCustomConfig().
